books.title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
books.author: Gabriel García Márquez
books.description: A novel that tells the story of the Buendía family over several generations in the fictional town of Macondo.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A dystopian novel about a totalitarian regime that uses surveillance, censorship, and manipulation to control the population.

books.title: The Little Prince
books.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
books.description: A philosophical and poetic tale about a young prince who travels to various planets, learning about life and human nature.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: A novel about racial injustice in the southern United States, seen through the eyes of a young girl.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: A romantic story that explores the complexities of morality and marriage in 19th century English society.

books.title: Don Quixote
books.author: Miguel de Cervantes
books.description: The story of a Spanish nobleman who, influenced by chivalric romances, decides to become a knight-errant.

books.title: The Odyssey
books.author: Homer
books.description: The classic epic that narrates the adventures of Odysseus on his long journey home to Ithaca after the Trojan War.

books.title: Crime and Punishment
books.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
books.description: The story of a young student who, driven by poverty and a philosophical theory, commits murder and faces moral consequences.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: A novel that examines the American Dream through the life of Jay Gatsby and his obsessive love for Daisy Buchanan.

books.title: In Search of Lost Time
books.author: Marcel Proust
books.description: A monumental work that explores themes of memory, time, and human experience through the narrator's life.

books.title: Ulysses
books.author: James Joyce
books.description: A complex novel that follows the lives of various characters in Dublin over the course of a single day.

books.title: Les Misérables
books.author: Victor Hugo
books.description: A work that explores social injustice in 19th century France through the life of Jean Valjean, an ex-convict.

books.title: Madame Bovary
books.author: Gustave Flaubert
books.description: The story of an unhappy woman who seeks to escape her boring life through romantic adventures and consumerism.

books.title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.description: A handsome and narcissistic young man retains his youth while his portrait ages and shows the consequences of his immoral actions.

books.title: The Metamorphosis
books.author: Franz Kafka
books.description: A man wakes up transformed into a giant insect, facing isolation and rejection from his family and society.

books.title: Anna Karenina
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.description: A tragic story of love and adultery in the high society of 19th century Russia.

books.title: The Lord of the Rings
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: A fantasy epic that follows the struggle of good versus evil in Middle-earth.

books.title: Wuthering Heights
books.author: Emily Brontë
books.description: A dark story of love and revenge set on the Yorkshire moors.

books.title: The Divine Comedy
books.author: Dante Alighieri
books.description: An epic poem describing Dante's journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Paradise.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: The story of a rebellious young man seeking authenticity and purpose in 1950s New York.
